rules.natural: Either the production has footage of animal behavior or it has footage of financial analysis.
Either the production violates financial disclosure regulations or it does not violate environmental protection regulations.
The production is approved by a network executive or it is approved by a regulatory body.
Provided that the production is approved by a regulatory body, it does not violate safety standards regulations.
Either the production is reviewed by a legal team or it is reviewed by an ethics committee.
In case the production is reviewed by an ethics committee, then if it is approved by a network executive, it does not violate safety standards regulations.
Should the production complete preproduction, then if it is reviewed by a legal team, then whenever it is approved by a network executive, it does not violate safety standards regulations.
The production completing preproduction is a consequence of it securing funding from a corporate sponsor.
The production secures funding from a corporate sponsor or it secures funding from a government grant.
Securing funding from a government grant implies that the production has completed preproduction.
The production being ready for filming follows from it having footage of financial analysis.
The production having a conflict with the creative director is necessary if it resolved the scheduling conflict issue.
The production resolves the scheduling conflict issue or it resolves the budget allocation issue.
If the production resolves the budget allocation issue, then provided that it requires a camera rig, then whenever it does not have footage of natural phenomenon, it has footage of furniture design.
If the production obtains clearance for archive footage, then obtaining clearance for music rights ensures that it does not violate environmental protection regulations.
Either the production requires a reshoot of animal sequences or it obtains clearance for archive footage.
Completing a risk assessment by the production leads to it implementing safety protocols.
The production implementing safety protocols means that if it passes the equipment safety inspection, then it does not violate safety standards regulations.
If the production has footage of natural phenomenon, then having footage of animal behavior implies it is ready for filming.
The production requiring a camera rig implies it requires a lighting system.
In case the production has a permit for the filming location, then if it requires a lighting system, then whenever it does not have footage of natural phenomenon, it has footage of furniture design.
Either the production has a permit for the filming location or it has a permit for animal interaction.

The production having a permit for animal interaction entails that if it requires a lighting system, then provided that it does not have footage of natural phenomenon, it has footage of furniture design.
The production not being ready for filming implies that it violates safety standards regulations.
The production not being ready for filming leads to it violating environmental protection regulations.
